purpose: To categorize and describe different fraud types and their characteristics.
title: Fraud Types

tables.description: Table categorizing different types of fraud with descriptions and characteristics.

cells: The card plastic is no longer in the possession of the true customer
Opportunist; local to lost or stolen event; use of card is immediate and aggressive
The card plastic was intercepted before reaching the true customer
Amateur or organized mail theft; takes advantage of weak Activation requirements
The card credentials (front of card for CTF Keyed and Mag Stripe for CTF Swipe) were duplicated for use to impersonate the true plastic
Use of skimming machines/software; Can stem from small to large scale merchant data breaches; sophisticated, organized fraudsters sell card credentials or duplicate plastics
eCommerce, Keyed, Mail Order, Phone Order, Recurring Payments
Ranges from individual hackers to sophisticated, organized rings; often a small transaction is attempted to test the card
Maintenance performed on an account that allows unauthorized use of the card funds
Identity fraud; Can be perpetrated through hacking, phishing, or other; Includes account changes such as address change, card request, addition of authorized users; sometimes familiar fraud
True victim did not apply for or have knowledge of initial card set up
Identify fraud; primarily seen on credit portfolios; sometimes familiar fraud
